results.title: Khalid’s surprise
results.brief_description: Machinima is animating using the 3D real-time virtual worlds of computer games as opposed to the complex, non real-time 3D animation software used by professionals. The game engine used to create this compelling short homage to a highly popular film is Battlefield 2, Battlefield 2: Modern Combat features a propaganda-fuelled single player campaign where gamers play both sides of a conflict in one of the most treacherous regions in the world - Kazakhstan

results.title: Khajuraho
results.creator_credit: Jehangir Bhownagary, Films Division, Government of India and Mohan Wadhwani
results.brief_description: The renaissance in Hindu culture of a thousand years ago as seen in the abandoned temples near the village of Khajuraho. Twenty of the original 85 temples remain and in their elaborate sculptures are reflected the religious concepts and the immense artistic vitality of the period.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jehangir Bhownagary, Films Division, Government of India and Mohan Wadhwani

results.title: Keyline
results.creator_credit: Perier Films and Rural Bank of New South Wales
results.brief_description: Describes the “keyline” method of conserving soil and building up its fertility. Stresses the need for soil and water conservation and proper use of soil in Australia. Illustrates, by means of diagrams, the position of a keyline on a property and demonstrates methods by which it can be selected and marked. Shows the best site for the construction of a keyline dam.

results.title: Keyboard skills in a language program
results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions and Neville Stanley
results.brief_description: Ilustrates a method of teaching keyboard skills to primary school children in an integrated language program. A child centered approach where pupils develop written language to use as keyboard drills instead of using set typing tests. The program describes the use of master work sheets and emphasises ergonomics and computer environments. Keyboard skills are seen as essential computer skills for extensive word processing.

results.title: Key to progress: machines in the service of men
results.brief_description: The secret of the difference between the old and new civilization is the machine made to serve our daily needs. This film shows how, through machinery and its power, conditions of the worker and the standard of living has improved; production per person has increased; number and variety of goods produced has been improved.

results.title: Key to progress
results.creator_credit: Lionel Cole, South-East Asia Shell Film Unit and Julian Sprio
results.brief_description: Illustrates the importance of trade in South East Asia, the operation of trade cycles, and the role of money. Points out that trade is not confined to the exchange of goods and produce, but that tourism, the hire of knowledge and experience and even cultural exchanges, constitute a form of trade.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lionel Cole, South-East Asia Shell Film Unit and Julian Sprio

results.title: Kew Gardens
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and British Council
results.brief_description: From the small garden of a princess, two centuries ago, the Royal Botanic Gardens at Kew have developed into a world-famous oasis of trees, flowers, shrubs and exotic plants, laid out amidst spacious lawns for the delight of over a million visitors a year. Shows Kew as a Commonwealth institution for botanical research, training student gardeners from home as well as overseas.

results.title: Kevin is fine
results.creator_credit: The Film House and Gordon Glenn
results.brief_description: A woman living in an isolated farm house in North Western Victoria believes her child has a learning deficiency. Her own fears and the attitude of her husband have prevented her from seeking help. Covers a series of events which lead her to take action. Cast: Nancy Black, Ross Williams.

results.title: Kerouac's road: a Franco-American odyssey
results.creator_credit: Eric Michel, ONF | NFB and Hermenegilde Chiasson
results.brief_description: Jack Kerouac, the novelist who revolutionised the form of American fiction and journalism, was born to a family of French-Canadians in exile and did not begin to understand English until he was six. Alienation, a quest for transcendence and the need to discover a new language would ultimately define his art. Through dramatised excerpts, period footage and candid interviews, this film shows how Kerouac’s restless seeking as a literary bohemian embodied a larger Franco-American pattern of emigration and displacement.
